label: Behavior 09275633
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: following a curved maritime route (the persistent small differences between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and gradual course evolution, suggest the vessel is navigating a predefined curved channel or coastal bend; position progression follows an approximately linear trajectory in geographic coordinates with slight northeasterly curvature, modeled by a second-order polynomial: lat(t) ≈ 57.4510 + 0.0078 × t + 0.0001 × t², lon(t) ≈ 8.7390 + 0.0085 × t + 0.0003 × t², where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
description: Speed profile: stable (the vessel maintains a nearly constant speed around 14.8–15.0 knots with minimal variation)
Course change: fluctuating (the COG varies between 26.7° and 35.6°, showing small but repeated oscillations despite consistent heading)
Heading fluctuation: gradual and consistent (the heading remains fixed at 33.0° throughout, indicating no active rudder correction or sensor update, while COG fluctuates around it)

Behavior intent: following a curved maritime route (the persistent small differences between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and gradual course evolution, suggest the vessel is navigating a predefined curved channel or coastal bend; position progression follows an approximately linear trajectory in geographic coordinates with slight northeasterly curvature, modeled by a second-order polynomial: lat(t) ≈ 57.4510 + 0.0078 × t + 0.0001 × t², lon(t) ≈ 8.7390 + 0.0085 × t + 0.0003 × t², where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
